required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assess Safety and Efficacy of Lacosamide in Patients With Partial Seizures
clinical_study.official_title: An International Open-label Extension Trial to Determine Safety and Efficacy of Long-term Oral Lacosamide (SPM 927) in Patients With Partial Seizures

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this trial is to determine safety and efficacy of Lacosamide under long term therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least 1 Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 Years)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 years)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events are any untoward medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Prematurely Discontinuing Due to a Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 Years)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 years)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events are any untoward medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 Years)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 years)
primary_outcome.description: A serious adverse event is any untoward medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not the event is related to treatment, with at least one of the follow outcomes: death, life-threatening, initial inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, significant or persistent disability/incapacity, congenital anomaly/birth defect, or an important medical event that may jeopardize the subject and require a medical/surgical intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Percentage Change From Baseline in 28-day Seizure Frequency During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 Years)
secondary_outcome.description: Median percentage change is the median value with respect to the percent change from Baseline across the population of subjects. Percentage change is calculated as 100 times the difference of the seizure frequency for the treatment period and the Baseline seizure frequency divided by the baseline seizure frequency. Negative changes from Baseline indicate an improvement (i.e., a reduction) in 28-day seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of at Least 50% Responders During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 Years)
secondary_outcome.description: At least 50 percent response is based on the percentage reduction in 28-day seizure frequency during the Treatment Period of the open-label extension relative to the Baseline Phase of the prior study. This endpoint reflects the percentage of subjects with at least 50% reduction (ie, at least 50% change) in 28-day partial onset seizure frequency

arm_group.description: 50 mg and 100 mg tablets up to 800 mg/day as twice day (BID) dosing

intervention.description: 50 mg and 100 mg tablets up to 800 mg/day as twice day (BID) dosing throughout the trial

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of Epilepsy
- completion of double blind trial
Exclusion Criteria:
- taking other investigational drug than Lacosamide
- meeting withdrawal criteria from double blind trial

results_reference.citation: Borghs S, de la Loge C, Brabant Y, Cramer J. Sensitivity testing of the Seizure Severity Questionnaire (SSQ). Epilepsy Behav. 2014 Feb;31:281-5. doi: 10.1016/j.yebeh.2013.10.010. Epub 2013 Nov 22.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was started in December of 2004 with recruitment occurring in Australia, Croatia, Czech Republic, Finland, France, Germany, Hungary, Lithuania, Poland, Russia, Spain, Sweden, and the United Kingdom. The study had last patient last visit in August of 2010.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Safety Set consists of all subjects who received at least 1 dose of Lacosamide.

group.title: Lacosamide
group.description: 50 mg and 100 mg tablets of lacosamide up to 800 mg/day as twice day (BID) dosing throughout the trial (flexible dosing)

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Other: Subject moved to another country
Other: Subject interested in other AED

group.title: Lacosamide
group.description: 50 mg and 100 mg tablets of lacosamide up to 800 mg/day as twice day (BID) dosing throughout the trial (flexible dosing)

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least 1 Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 Years)
outcome.description: Adverse events are any untoward medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.
outcome.time_frame: During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 years)
outcome.population: Of the 376 subjects who entered the study, 376 are included in this summary based on the Safety Set (SS). SS population: number of subjects treated.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 Years)
measure.description: A serious adverse event is any untoward medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not the event is related to treatment, with at least one of the follow outcomes: death, life-threatening, initial inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, significant or persistent disability/incapacity, congenital anomaly/birth defect, or an important medical event that may jeopardize the subject and require a medical/surgical intervention.
measure.population: Of the 376 subjects who entered the study, 376 are included in this summary based on the Safety Set (SS). SS population: number of subjects treated.

outcome.title: Median Percentage Change From Baseline in 28-day Seizure Frequency During the Treatment Period (up to 5.5 Years)
outcome.description: Median percentage change is the median value with respect to the percent change from Baseline across the population of subjects. Percentage change is calculated as 100 times the difference of the seizure frequency for the treatment period and the Baseline seizure frequency divided by the baseline seizure frequency. Negative changes from Baseline indicate an improvement (i.e., a reduction) in 28-day seizure frequency.
outcome.population: Of the 376 subjects who were enrolled/treated in the study, 376 are included in this summary based on the Full Analysis Set (FAS). FAS population: number of subjects treated with at least 1 post-baseline seizure diary day with available data during the SP774 study.

reported_events.time_frame: The adverse event summaries are based on data collected during the 5.5 years of the study for all 376 patients

group.title: Lacosamide
group.description: 50 mg and 100 mg tablets of lacosamide up to 800 mg/day as twice day (BID) dosing throughout the trial (flexible dosing)

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: UCB has > 60 but <= 180 days to review results communications prior to public release and may delete information that is confidential and compromises ongoing studies or is considered proprietary. This restriction is not intended to compromise the objective scientific integrity of the manuscript, it being understood that the results shall be published regardless of outcome.
